channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16621] HBCK should have -fixHFileLinks
item.description:
Similar to -fixReferenceFiles, HBCK should be able to sideline dangling HFile Links as well.

We have seen a couple of cases, where due to HDFS-level fsck run which deleted files with missing blocks, the cluster is left with dangling HFIle Links, and regions cannot be opened because of these. Only a manual and error-prone finding and clearing of HFileLinks can save the tables regions.

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Hello, I would like to work on this issue.

Hello, I would like to work on this issue.

Thanks. I've assigned the issue to you.
Please find attached the initial patch. Also I refactored HBaseFsck::offlineReferenceFileRepair method to use a helper method for gathering absolute file path, instead of the for loop.

Enis Soztutar Could you please review my patch? Also, next time I will only attach the patch related to the issue.

+        return isFile(fs, isDir, p);

+      } catch (IOException ioe) {

+        // Maybe the file was moved or the fs was disconnected.

+        LOG.warn("Skipping file " + p + " due to IOException", ioe);

+        return false;

Is the above safe to do ? See HBASE-16527

No as https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-16529 says also. I changed the contract of this filter in my next patch only to filter paths (implements PathFilter instead of extending AbstractFileStatusFilter). In this way it is guaranteed that it will return everything that looks like an HFileLink (file or directory). Also I added a test case, where we create a directory, which name looks like an HFileLink and also contains some files. Now it is also sidelined (I am not sure if it is a valid test case).
